H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H3985.def: = state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H2973.def: = to be and/or behave like one with little insight, education or wisdom; ≈ pejorative (see the related term {L:אִוֶּלֶת<SDBH:אִוֶּלֶת>})

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H5923.def: = bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression

H4147.def: = material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H2061.def: = wild, four-footed, predatory canine; light-brown fur, similar to jackal, but much bigger; ◄ Canis lupus; ► commonly prey on flocks; ≈ regarded as ravenous and fierce; symbol of roaming, opportunistic, dangerous, fierce, and clever banditry

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H5246.def: = one of the great cat family of about 2 m in length and of a yellowish brown color with black spots arranged in rosettes all over the body and the tail; ◄ Panthera pardus; ► hunts by stalking prey; ≈ symbol of violent danger

H8245.def: = state in which humans are unable to sleep

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H2963.def: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H7231.def: = process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency

H4878.def: = process by which people turn away from someone they had pledged to serve

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5003.def: = action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry

H1413.def: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2109.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = state in which animals are sexually aroused

H7904.def: literally: to be equipped with testicles; hence, probably: = state in which animals have a strong sexual drive

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5358.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H3617.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5189.def: literally: spreading out; hence: = a secondary woody stem arising from the trunk or bough of a tree or the main stem of a shrub

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4801.def: = state in which humans, deities, objects, or events are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H827.def: = long, narrow container ► for storing one's arrows

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H7567.def: = causative action by which constructions such as towns, villages, and buildings are physically destroyed ► weakening a nation

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H5236.def: = state in which something is associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1366.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4456.def: = rain that falls during the first half of April, before the harvest; ► provides the moisture that is crucial for the grains to mature; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH ({A:ABD})

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2708.def: = patterns of behavior that a community expects its members to follow

H7620.def: = the cycle of seven days from the first day to the seventh, which is the {L:sabbath<SDBH:שַׁבָּת>}

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7789.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H3353.def: = someone who has made it his profession to catch animals and birds with the help of nets and traps; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression

H7918.def: = process by which events become less intense

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H4889.def: = causative action or process by which humans, deities, or animals cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to be affected by violence, destruction, death, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive or deadly impact

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3619.def: = relatively large container ◄ made woven material such as grass or reeds; ► used for storing fruit, but also by hunters to store birds that they have caught

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H8080.def: literally: to be fat; hence: = state in which humans or animals look healthy and strong ◄ as a result of an abundance of food; ≈ it is important to note that fatness is usually regarded as a good quality in the OT, even though the causes and consequences are not necessarily considered positive; sometimes, however, fatness is associated with dullness and unresponsiveness

H6245.def: = action by which a deity turns his attention to the condition of humans

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H6743.def: = action by which an outside force (perhaps divine) quickly comes over a person, gaining control over the person or causing some immediate outcome

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5358.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H8047.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H5012.def: = action by which humans speak or act as a prophet

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H7287.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise authority over (other) humans, animals, and areas, often with focus on the manner in which this is done

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction
